title: Tactical Social Skills and Strategic Behavior Development Program for Athletes: Integrating Social Relationships and Cultural Contexts

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of sports event operations, team strategy development experience, awareness of social interactions within groups, and foundational recognition of cultural and political factors
context.additional_context: Practice-centered education for in-service professionals reflecting real-game situations in BYOD environments. Utilizes scenarios incorporating social elements (team politics, culture, hierarchy). Particularly includes cases of civic rights-team system interactions and relationship coordination among players from diverse cultural backgrounds.

learning_goals: Learners can improve tactical decision-making and social relationship management skills within teams by 80%+ through simulation activities resembling real-game environments.
Learners can improve communication efficiency and social coordination skills by 70% during the process of executing tactical actions through team collaboration.

Learners can analyze three or more soccer match videos per week over four weeks, derive five or more tactical strengths/weaknesses, and write a five-page portfolio (match analysis table, tactical application cases, improvement plans) reflecting cultural contexts (e.g., local fan culture, stadium hierarchy) and team dynamics (e.g., captain leadership, internal politics). The portfolio must achieve "excellent" grades in four or more of five rubric items (analysis depth, tactical understanding, creativity, feasibility, clarity of expression).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
